info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 12:42AM CDT until July 05 at 5:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR BOONE AND NORTHEASTERN WINNEBAGO COUNTIES... At 1242 AM CDT, doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms are beginning to move out of the warned area. 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen across a narrow corridor from central Winnebago County to central Boone County, with isolated locations nearing 3-4 inches of rainfall. HAZARD...Flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Rapid-onset flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses, as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas. The threat for ongoing flooding continues in the following areas... Rockford, Belvidere, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, Rockton, Poplar Grove, Candlewick Lake, Cherry Valley, Capron, Timberlane, Garden Prairie and Caledonia. Although rainfall may have ended, water levels may continue to rise in some areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Expect flooding of creeks, ditches, canals, and storm sewers, as well roadways, underpasses, and other poor drainage areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
